parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Insufficient Oil Pressure Leading to Engine Failure
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Insufficient oil pressure can cause engine damage, leading to costly repairs or even engine replacement, which can leave the driver stranded and compromise vehicle safety.
symptoms: engine burning up main rod bearings.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Excessive oil consumption can lead to premature engine wear, engine damage, and increased maintenance costs, which can compromise vehicle safety and performance.
symptoms: Consuming 1 quart of oil every 600 miles
consuming 5 quarts of oil between oil changes (3000 miles).

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Loss of acceleration power can increase the risk of accidents, especially when attempting to pass or merge with traffic, and can compromise vehicle safety.
symptoms: vehicle hesitates or stalls when trying to accelerate
loss of power when trying to pass or accelerate.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Unintended acceleration can lead to loss of control, accidents, and potential injuries or fatalities. It can also cause emotional distress and anxiety for the driver.
symptoms: the engine revs up while sitting still
the vehicle lunges forward without pressing the accelerator
the vehicle moves forward without the driver's control.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The malfunction of the transmission shift indicator can cause the vehicle to be in a different gear than indicated, leading to unintended movement or loss of control, which can increase the risk of accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The transmission shift indicator shows the vehicle is in park
but the vehicle is actually in neutral
the vehicle can roll freely forward or backward
the transmission jumps to park and locks
